info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 9:00AM CDT until June 8 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Cimarron River near Buffalo affecting Harper, Woodward and Woods Counties.
Cimarron River near Ames affecting Kingfisher, Blaine and Major Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Cimarron River near Ames.
* WHEN...From this morning to Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Some inundation of low-lying, rural areas along the river may occur from near Orienta in Major County... downstream to areas along the Cimarron River in extreme northeastern Blaine County... and near the State Highway 51 bridge crossing in Kingfisher County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Blaine, OK; Kingfisher, OK; Major, OK
